title: lieutfunaki
author: lieutfunaki
content: I have an Original Helium miner that I purchased that absolutely killed it at one point. The firmware SD card has since become corrupted and failed. Does anyone know if:1. The original Helium Miner equipment is still viable for mining on the network?2. Where to get firmware file for the miner so I can replace the SD card?Helium support isn't emailing me back. Thanks.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Would you mind to share the exact model of your Helium miner?If you just say original Helium miner we can't guarantee that we can give you the correct firmware for your unit.And I'd like to suggest try to hard reset the unit by holding the reset button(5 or 15 seconds) then release and check if it solves the issue but if not update here and add more details about your unit.

comments.body: https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/helium-hotspotIt's one of these. Literally the original hotspot, ordered from helium. It has no model # on it that I can find.

comments.author: lieutfunaki
comments.body: None of the above. This is the original hotspot marketed and sold by Helium (no longer available). Helium support finally sent me the firmware file. I successfully flashed it to the microSD and got a green light back on the miner/hotspot. Next question is, how do I make sure it is connected to the App again?
